title: Understanding Inverse of a Matrix
text: To find the inverse of a 2x2 matrix, first recall that not all matrices have inverses. An inverse exists if and only if the determinant of the matrix is not zero.

title: Determinant Calculation
text: The determinant of a 2x2 matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}$$ is calculated as 'ad-bc'. Make sure to calculate this first before trying to find the inverse.

title: Formula for Inverse of 2x2 Matrix
text: Once you have a non-zero determinant, the inverse of $$\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}$$ is given by $$\begin{bmatrix} d & -b \\ -c & a \end{bmatrix}*(1/(ad-bc))$$.

title: Creating A New Matrix
text: Substitute the values from the matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 2 & 2 \end{bmatrix}$$ into the formula to form a new matrix. Note the positions and sign changes for certain elements: Swap the positions of $$1$$ and $$2$$ for the largest diagonal and change the signs of the other diagonal.

title: Check Your Determinant
text: What was the value of your determinant? Did you find 'ad-bc' to be non-zero? If not, the inverse doesn't exist, and you'll need to enter 'NAN'.
